name: Running for Water for Africa 5K
description:
We welcome you to the 14th edition of our great event which we continue to hold at the Walnut Beach Pavilion! Because the race is in October, the Fall leaves will have begun to change.  It's a beautiful time of year to get out and enjoy the crisp air.  And you'll be helping an amazing cause!
We're also bringing back our exciting gift certificate raffle this year that will include many local restaurants.
Our course is designed for all abilities of runners and walkers. Flat scenic roads except for one minor incline at the beginning that start and finish near the beach.  You’ll be able to run fast, or easy, or walk comfortably at any pace.
There is plentiful parking available in the Beach parking lot. 

This Year's Project:
A Kitagwenda secondary school with about 2,000 girls and boys have depended on a very dangerous stream to provide their water needs. The stream has claimed the lives of several students and locals as they stooped to fetch the dirty water. We can help by drilling a new well and constructing a water delivery system.  With your assistance we can change the lives of so many.
The areas where we drill our wells are very rural. Kids typically walk miles each day to and from the watering hole to fetch water for drinking, bathing and cooking.  Unfortunately, the villagers share the water source with various animals so they have to boil it before using it. With your help, we can make this possible!

As always your contributions are fully tax deductible. We are approved by the Internal Revenue Service as a 501(c)(3) organization.

5K Course (3.1miles) is a computer timed event which you can RUN OR WALK.  Participants will need to complete the entire 3.1 mile course to be scored in results. This event offers awards to the overall male and female champions as well as age group awards. If you walk this distance, you will be grouped into all finishers and be eligible for awards.

Service dogs who are trained to perform a task are permitted by the ADA. Comfort dogs or emotional support dogs are not covered by the ADA and are not permitted at Muscoot Farm.

name: The 38th Annual Women's Distance Festival 5K
description:
The WDF is more than just a test of endurance; it’s a powerful step toward empowering women and supporting those in need. With every stride, every mile, and every finish line crossed, we are contributing to the vital work of the Center for Safety & Change and their mission to support, shelter and provide services to victims and survivors of sexual assault, domestic violence, human trafficking and other crimes.

 

 

This year’s theme CHASE THE CHANGE embodies the spirit of this event. It reminds us that change starts with each of us—through our actions, our unity, and our commitment to making the world a safer and more equitable place. Together, we’re not just chasing the finish line; we’re chasing a future where everyone can thrive.

 

 

The Women's Distance Festival was created by the Road Runners Club of America as a protest to a lack of competitive races for women both in the Olympics and nationally. It was believed as recently as the 1980 Olympics, that women could not compete at distances of greater than 1500 meters, which is less than 1 mile!  In America, in July of 1980, the first Women's Distance Festivals were run opposite the Mens' Marathon at the Moscow Olympics. The Rockland Road Runners picked up the Women's Distance Festival in 1988, and it has now grown to be the largest Women and Girls 5K in the tristate area!

 

 

Join us to experience the ENERGY, POWER, and DETERMINATION of this incredible event as we come together for the 38th Annual Women's Distance Festival 5K Run/Walk on July 13th at 8:00am.  There will also be a virtual event for those who cannot participate in person.  The virtual event will run from Sunday, July 13 through Sunday, July 20. Join us as we come together to raise money to help the Center for Safety & Change in their mission to support, shelter and provide services to victims and survivors of sexual assault, domestic violence, human trafficking and other crimes.

 

 

Lace up your sneakers, feel the energy, and let’s CHASE THE CHANGE!

name: Volksläufe - The People's Race
description:
For five decades, the Volksläufe has brought together runners from all walks of life, making it far more than a race — it’s a cherished community tradition! The Volksläufe, meaning “The People’s Race” in German, embraces the spirit of family, friendship, and fitness, inviting participants to a fun and meaningful celebration. Hosted by the Frankenmuth Jaycees, this year’s event is set to be our biggest yet, with every mile and every cheer contributing to charitable causes close to our community’s heart.

 

Our 50th ANNUAL race will feature the traditional 5K, 10K, and half-marathon distances, guiding runners through Frankenmuth’s picturesque Bavarian streets, scenic countryside, and the peaceful Cass River. But that’s not all! For our youngest runners and those new to racing, we offer the 2K Fun Run, a shorter route filled with the same high spirits and cheers as the longer races. The Volksläufe has something for everyone, from serious athletes to families looking for holiday fun!

 

As always, the Frankenmuth Jaycees’ mission goes beyond the race. Every dollar raised will fund our spectacular July 3rd fireworks display and support various charitable initiatives throughout the year. After crossing the finish line, stick around to enjoy post-race festivities with food, live music, and family-friendly activities!

 

The Volksläufe is about people — racers, families, friends, and our incredible volunteers. Together, we’ll make the 50th edition unforgettable! Thank you to our runners, sponsors, vendors, and community members for supporting this tradition and making a difference in our community. 🏅

name: Raven Rocks 10k Run and Raven 100k Challenge
description:
The Raven Rocks 10k Trail Run is BACK! Woo hoo!

 

We have also brought back the 100k Raven Challenge with all of the fun elements from last year -- plus we're looking to add a few more activities to the challenge during the month of November! 

 

You can sign up for one or the other -- or do BOTH! Signups for both events at the same time get a discount which appears at checkout. 

 

Shirts this year are one design and available either on long-sleeved cotton shirts (traditional) and/or short sleeved tech fabric shirts (new!). You can purchase one, both, or neither shirt. If you are a purely virtual Raven 100k Challenge runner, we will mail you your shirt if ordered along with your finisher woodallion. 

 

As always, these Raven events support the Friends of Trailside Museum and Ward Pound Ridge Reservation. During registration we encourage runners and challengers to join as members of the museum to support their non-profit educational and conservation purpose. 

 

Once the donation vehicle has been established, we will support the Friends of the Cross River Mountain Fire Tower. We are working with the Westchester Parks Foundation who plan to raise funds to support Westchester County and NY State in the restoration of the fire tower to Ward Pound Ridge Reservation. That fundraising account will be set up soon with a range of support levels. More news to come soon! 

 

More information about each event

 

Raven Rocks Run - 10k Trail Run

 

The Raven Rocks Run is a challenging 10k trail run at Ward Pound Ridge Reservation in Cross River, NY.

 

The TENTH running of the race will be in November.

 

Race will be in-person Sunday, November 9, 2025 starting at 9am. (Final race date approval pending county permit.)

 

The race will start in the Meadow near the fallen oak tree and its massive remains. The course passes by the spot where the Leatherman’s Loop begins. Instead of heading towards the river as the Loop does, the Raven Rocks Run 10k course climbs and climbs up to the two highest points in the park (Raven Rocks Overlook and the Fire Tower Summit) before heading back for a (mostly) downhill and (relatively) flat finish.

 

The course passes by the site of the former Blue Trail fire tower which is the highest point in the park. We are working towards getting back the tower to its former spot in the park. See Course Map page for course details.

 

More information about the race and tower project is on the About page and the FAQ page of our ravenrocksrun.org website.

We are looking forward to November when we will run this event for the TENTH time!

 

Important: Our Raven Rocks Run race plans are contingent on permit approval from the Westchester County Department of Parks, Recreation, and Conservation. This approval is not guaranteed but has been obtained for the prior nine races. As in all prior years we open registration with the understanding that the race will take place. We will update runners if the permit is not approved for the current year. 

 

Raven 100k Challenge

 

The Raven 100k Challenge is simple: first, register for the challenge. Then run, hike, or walk 100k during the month of November 1st - 30th, 2025.

 
Note: You can register as late as November 15 for the 100k challenge and enter your mileage to date when you register.

 

This works out to an average of around 3k per day or 25k (15 miles) per week.

 

If you complete the challenge, you will receive a wooden finisher medallion. Shirts are optional. 

 

The Raven 100k Challenge supports the Friends of Trailside Museum and Ward Pound Ridge Reservation, a 501(c)3 not for profit organization based at the Trailside Museum at Ward Pound Ridge Reservation.

 

You can also join the Friends of Trailside Museum and Ward Pound Ridge Reservation for annual membership during signup.

 

Bonus achievements

 

In addition to running, walking, or hiking 100k during November, there are several bonus achievement badges you can unlock if you are able: 

  • Run 10k on the Raven Rocks Run course (raven badge)
  • Run 5x 10k on the Raven Rocks Run course (ultra raven badge - subs out the raven badge when this badge is achieved)
  • Run 10x 10k on the Raven Rocks Run course (flock badge - subs out the ultra raven badge when this badge is achieved)
  • Take a selfie at the Raven Rocks Overlook and send it in (photographer badge)
  • Submit a photo of yourself on a run with your "I Voted" sticker or if you can't vote in the election, next to someone with an "I Voted" sticker. Or simply log a run, walk, or hike on election day! (bald eagle badge) 
  • Submit a photo of you running on Thanksgiving. Or simply log a run, walk, or hike on Thanksgiving. (turkey badge)
  • Submit a photo of you running on Veteran's Day. Or simply log a run, walk, or hike on Veteran's Day. (veterans day badge)
  • Photo of a raven or Raven related site, store, zoo, etc. and send it in (raven citizen award)
  • Do a run in the dark to Raven Rocks (night owl badge)
  • 200k distance in November (snowy owl badge)
  • 300k distance in November (white raven badge)
  • Run the Raven Rocks 10k course 5x IN ONE DAY (Raven Rockstar Badge)
  • Run the Raven Rocks 10k course 32 times in November (Peeter Badge)
  • Witness a meteor falling during a run (Meteor Badge)
  • Read a stanza from Edgar Allan Poe's "The Raven" poem and send us a link. Use soundcloud, youtube, facebook, whatever service you want. (wise owl badge)
  • These badges will be displayed on the physical wooden finisher "medallion" once you complete the Raven Challenge. We will also show badges achieved on the summary page.
  • Any other badge ideas? We are open to suggestions :) 

 

In addition, we will have recognition for:

  • First 3 men and First 3 women to 100k
  • Top 3 men and Top 3 women in total kilometers.
  • Anyone in contention for these Top 3 awards must make their entries in a timely manner:
    • All entries must be made within 36 hours of your run/walk.  
    • This is to prevent participants from "batch entering" their results.
    • Keep your results up to date if you are in the running!
  • Note: In order to win these awards distance submissions need to be made via GPX files.
  • See instructions submitting results on RunSignUp Raven 100k Challenge page.

 

Halfway bonus search

 

For those in the area near Ward Pound Ridge Reservation we have a special treat in mind. If you opt-in via the badge update form (after you pass the 50 kilometer mark on your Raven 100k Challenge) we will send you GPS coordinates to somewhere in the park where we have hidden a small challenge surprise for you to find. It will be obvious once you get there, but not easy to find unless you have the coordinates. Complete instructions and advice come with the GPS challenge confirmation email.

 

Everyone will have a different and unique spot somewhere in the park. Some will be further off-trail than others depending on how familiar you are with the park. 

 

Let us know when you find your halfway bonus (or if you can't find it!).

"This disease can take my bride Kelly at any time; I can't sit by and do nothing. I need your help to give Kelly and others with AA a fighting chance."

name: 13th Annual Happy Jack 5K
description:
The Happy Jack 5k is an annual, family friendly 5k walk/run that honors the life of our son, John Thomas "Happy Jack" Doyle. All proceeds go to The Happy Jack Fund which provides annual scholarships to HS students who have lost a sister/brother as well as provide families with support who are suffering through the loss of a child. Registration is currently open and we encourage everyone to sign up ASAP. Sincerely,

The Happy Jack Race Committee

 

Description

Join The Happy Jack Fund at our 13th Annual Happy Jack 5K on October 18, 2025, at Germonds Park West Nyack, NY

The Course

This is an out and back style race starting in the parking lot of Germonds Park in West Nyack, NY, exit left out of the park and follow Germonds road to the end making another left hand turn until you make a right turn onto Lyncrest Avenue. Follow Lyncrest to the end making a right onto Shetland Drive, taking that to the end and make a right onto Teakwood Lane (turns into Stratford Place). Take that to the end and make a right onto Jolen Drive and then a left onto Whitewood Drive. This will take you back out to Germonds Road where you turn left and then a quick right and follow it back to the park where the finish line is located. 

Walkers will follow the same route (behind the runners) and once on Lyncrest you make a right onto Jolen Drive and then a right onto Whitewood Drive. 

The race course is clearly marked with signs and will also have our volunteers there to direct and support you.

Event Shirts

Event shirts will be given out to the first 200 participants who register. Sizes are not guaranteed and will be given out as supplies last. Race bib and shirt pick up will be held on Friday October 17, 2025, at District 96 in New City and will also be available on race day stating at 7:30am. 

Results and Awards

Awards will be given to the top Female & Male overall winners as well as the top 5 Teams with the best with the most registered runner/walkers in main race. 

Age group awards in the race will be awarded to the top 3 female and male in each of the following age groups; 9-14, 15-19, 20-29, 30-39, 40-49, 50-59 and 60+.

Parking and Bathrooms

All participants and spectators can park in the lower parking lot of Germonds Park. Do not park in the coned area and/or near the stage. Bathrooms are located on the West side of the parking lot. 

Covid Safety

All participants are required to sign the waiver upon signing up. You may not attend the event if you have experienced symptoms of COVID-19 or tested positive in the fourteen (14) days prior to the event. Should you test positive in the fourteen (14) days after the event you must notify The Happy Jack Fund at racecommittee@happyjackfund.org so that we may notify staff and participants as necessary. 

Race Contact Info

If you have any questions about this event, please contact us at racecommittee@happyjackfund.org

Race Proceeds

All proceeds from this event will be used towards The Happy Jack Annual Scholarships as well as supporting Families within our community who need the support of The Happy Jack Fund. 

 

"Thank you for helping us share Jack's smile with someone who really needs it"

name: First State Duathlon
description:
The First State Duathlon is a fun duathlon competition that will take place on the trails at Bellevue State Park in Wilmington, Delaware. There are three legs to the race: a trail run, followed by a trail bike ride, followed by a shorter trail run. Athletes can race as an individual or with a 2 or 3 person relay team. Competitors will need to provide their own trail bike (and helmet) for the bike leg of the race.

The first leg distance will be approximately 5K (3.1 miles) on the Bellevue State Park cross country trail. The second leg distance will consist of three ~3.2K loops (~2.3 miles each) (total approximately ~7 miles). The third leg will be a shorter (approximately 0.8 mile) leg along the oval track/trail. The course map is available on our website and may be adjusted slightly to ensure a smooth race and transition between each of the legs and finish.

The 2020 First State Duathlon will be competitive and fun. All ages and skill sets welcome. Last year the top competitors finished in less than an hour; the slowest competitors finished in about two hours. Please visit our website for more information or for course records.

name: Dempsey Dash 5K and 1k Fun Run
description:
On March 14, Brenau University will host its annual Dempsey Dash 5K and 1K Fun Run in memory of the university’s long-time executive vice president and CFO, Wayne Dempsey. The event benefits the Wayne W. Dempsey Endowed Scholarship Fund, first funded in Dempsey’s memory in 2014 by an anonymous donor.


Official Dempsey Dash T-shirts provided for all pre-registered participants by February 20. All other registered participants through race day will receive shirt while supplies last.


Certified race: Certification # is GA24002DJ


Why A Bowtie?
Those who knew Dr. Dempsey remember him as quite the clotheshorse. Always dressed to the nines, he had a reputation for impeccable style. He was almost always seen around campus in a well-coordinated suit and tie or a fashionable sport coat. Even his sons recall him as a younger man cutting the grass in a pair of penny loafers! It's unclear exactly how his signature bow tie habit began. His older son claims to have started wearing bow ties in the late 80s, forging his own fashion identity. The elder Dempsey, admiring the look, decided to give them a try himself. Taking it a step further, Dr. Dempsey even sought out lessons to learn how to tie them properly. He and his son spent hours practicing and mastering the skill. From there, the trademark look was born. Dr. Dempsey frequently sported bow ties in his daily professional life, and they became his calling card. After his passing, his sons inherited his tie collection, and one continues to wear the bow ties today. In this way, the bow tie has become a unique and touching way to remember a great and unique man

name: 12th Annual Keris Kares Royal Run: The Superhero Edition
description:
When a child is diagnosed with cancer, everything STOPS. A family’s whole life changes just like that and it does not go back to normal. Bills and stress are at an all-time high and help from others is critical. One in 285 children in the U.S. will be diagnosed with cancer by the time they are 20 years old. Childhood cancer research and treatments are vastly and consistently underfunded.  Keris, was a proud Kindergarten graduate of Newnan Crossing Elementary School. She was a vibrant and faithful child who bravely battled a rare form of pediatric brain cancer called Diffuse Intrinsic Pontine Glioma (DIPG) from the age of 4 until her transition at the age of 6.  She made a lasting impression on those that knew her. The name Keris means love and charity.  Our driving motivation is to pay it forward with love and charity and bless other hurting families the same way the community blessed Keris. Proceeds from this event fund our Family Emergency Fund, Keris Kares 4 the Arts program, and our Food for Families Program. Your registration helps us KARE for families, kids, and teachers.  

THANK YOU FOR YOUR PARTICIPATION!

After the race, join us at the 1st Avenue Park, 2 blocks south of the Court Square, for characters, games, petting zoo, food trucks, face painting, and many more magical surprises.

To be a Sponsor of the 12th Annual Keris Kares Royal Run email KerisKares@gmail.com or call 678-596-2867.

name: BHM26.2 2025- The Alabama Race Series
description:
BHM26.2 2025 is Alabama's only fully charitable race series, benefitting Magic Moments on Sunday, October 5th. Comprised of a full marathon, 5-person marathon relay, half marathon, 10k, 5k and kid's fun run, BHM26.2's Race Series brings exciting courses to the Birmingham Metro area! With over 2,000 runners, this event is one of Alabama's most highly attended races with a family-friendly After Party for participants and anyone supporting the cause! 

 

 Our specialized Marathon course is a beautiful but challenging 13.1 looped run through the city and neighborhoods of Hoover with a mix of rolling hills, flat terrain, and a beautiful waterfront. This course will have frequent water stations, cheer stations, and medical stations to ensure you are safe and have an incredible race day experience!

 

Our Marathon Relay is RETURNING for the 2025 race and is intended for a fun team building activity to tackle our marathon course with your team! The leg options are set to be 5 miles, 5 miles, 3.1 miles, 6.9 miles, and 6.2 miles. Teams may opt for less than 5 runners if the team member chooses to run consecutive legs. All members of the relay team will receive their medals together as their team crosses the official BHM26.2 finish line! Registration for this event will open February 1st.

 

Our popular Half Marathon, which sold out last year, is back and better than ever. This year’s course takes you through scenic views, winding through the city and neighborhood streets and along a beautiful waterfront. With improved logistics, enhanced support, and a festive race-day atmosphere, we’re making sure your experience is unforgettable. Whether you're a seasoned runner or a first-timer, this is a race you won’t want to miss. 

 

The 10K and 5K races are perfect for runners of all levels looking for a challenge or a fun fitness goal. Both courses offer a great mix of flat stretches, rolling hills, and scenic views, ideal for those looking for a good challenge and fun race environment. These will have a vibrant crowd support, water stations, a medical station, and a finish line celebration you won't forget. Whether you’re racing for time or just for fun, these events are designed to inspire you every step of the way!

 

The Kid’s Fun Run is geared towards children and patients who wish to be a part of our race weekend. Children under the age of 8 must be accompanied by an adult. This event is a stroller friendly event and is around ¼ mile!

 

We also have an After Party for everyone to enjoy right after you cross the Finish Line on Sunday! Join us at The Finley Center, right inside by the Finish Line, for a post race meal, live music, drinks, a kids zone, and more!

 

The best part? ALL proceeds benefit Magic Moments, the only wish-granting organization devoted exclusively to children in Alabama with chronic life-threatening or acute life-altering conditions. Lace up your shoes and join us October 5th as we run for the children who are chasing a cure.

name: John Jay Community Trail Race
description:
The John Jay Community 5k Trail Race (http://jjtrail.org) is a competitive community race on the new John Jay Community Cross Country Trail. The course starts on the lower fields of the John Jay Campus and quickly goes into the wooded trails adjacent to the middle school and high school. It ends on the John Jay Contest Track & Field next to Route 121. The trails are challenging and hilly in the woods.

The John Jay 4k Trail Walk is a non-competitive walk through the main parts of the John Jay Community Trail. The walkers will start after the 5k runners are in the woods. Most of the trail is the same except for approximately 1k of the southern hill loop that is skipped by the walkers.

Both courses end at the John Jay Contest Field.

Note: since the trail and course is on school grounds, animals are not permitted - except for service animals within the ADA definition.

Sign up NOW - first 150 pre-registered runners/walkers to sign up receive a race t-shirt! 

The Kids Jay Dash race will take place after the finish of the 5k run/4k walk. It will be held on the track and the distance will be 200 meters. The first 30 kids to sign up for the Dash will receive a t-shirt!

The John Jay Community Cross Country Trail has been developed and built by student and community volunteers to provide a home course for the Westchester County and New York State Championship John Jay Cross Country teams as well as for the community. If you are interested in helping out, either via donation or volunteering your time, please reach out to us at jjtrailrace@gmail.com for more information. Thank you!

SPONSORS

Thank you to our wonderful sponsors! We are always looking for additional sponsors for the community races! We truly appreciate the sponsors who enable us to host a fun and competitive race event.

We are seeking sponsors for the 2026 races. If you are interested in sponsoring or renewing your sponsorship, please contact us at jjtrailrace@gmail.com. 

A listing of the current year's sponsors is here: https://runsignup.com/Race/Sponsors/NY/CrossRiver/JohnJayCommunityTrailRace or click on the "Sponsor" link above. We will reset this list and update with new sponsors in the months before the next race.

We could not put on the event without our SPONSOR PARTNERS -- and we encourage everyone to patronize them!

name: Mushroom Cap Half Marathon and FUNGI 5 Miler Event
description:
Race Information

Half Marathon
Date: Saturday, November 8, 2025
Time: 8:00AM 
Start Line: Birch and Church Alley
Time Limit: 3.5 Hours from participants start time

 

The Mushroom Cap Half Marathon and FunGi Five Miler, proudly presented by Chatham Financial — where small-town charm meets the thrill of racing for homegrown mushrooms!

 

This year, the Mushroom Cap Half Marathon celebrates its 10th Anniversary, marking a decade of honoring everything that makes Kennett Square truly extraordinary.  It’s more than a race—it’s a celebration of KSQ’s charm, mushroom heritage, fitness, community spirit, and the power of giving back. For 10 years, the Mushroom Cap has showcased the unique character of the Mushroom Capital of the World, bringing runners together to embrace the joy of fitness while supporting meaningful charitable causes in our community. Join us for this special milestone as we celebrate a decade of running, community, and giving!

 

Take on a course brimming with character and challenge!  Hills are part of what makes this course unforgettable—own the climbs, embrace the challenge, and enjoy the reward of the downhill!  As you journey through the picturesque borough of Kennett Square, you’ll wind through quiet neighborhoods, scenic country roads, and pass historic landmarks like turn-of-the-century barns, Revolutionary War sites, and iconic mushroom farms. Along the way, stay energized at our lively, community-powered hydration stations, buzzing with local spirit and endless enthusiasm to cheer you on! 

 

FunGi 5 Miler
Date: Saturday, November 8, 2025
Time: 8:00AM 
Start Line: Birch and Church Alley
Time Limit: 3.5 Hours from participants start time

 

This year’s Mushroom Cap 5 Miler isn’t just a race—it’s the face of a Fun-GI! 🍄

From quaint neighborhood streets to community-centered hydration stations, every step of the course celebrates the heart and soul of Kennett Square. Conquer a few shiitake kicker hills, then enjoy a breezy downhill finish that leads you straight into the vibrant 10th Year Celebration Festival, where the community comes alive!  This is no ordinary 5 Miler—it's a journey through historic homes, iconic landmarks, and charming streets lined with towering 100+ year-old live oak trees. Along the way, you’ll soak in the sights of mushroom farms and the unique character of the Mushroom Capital of the World.  Get ready for an unforgettable run and an epic celebration of fitness, fun, and fungi!

 

Runner Perks

  • A shiny, finisher medal to prove you did the thing
  • Swag so good, you’ll want to run just for the gear
  • A free Victory Brewing or Athletic Brewing Beer - because you earned it
  • Post race nosh - local produce & carbs 
  • Live music by the Holy Smokers 
  • A community fueled post race festival

Dos Gringos will be onsite serving up their legendary Taco Bar—loaded with fresh, flavorful options to satisfy your runner hunger.

For just $12, you can dive into the taco buffet. Taco Bar tickets must be pre-purchased with registration—no sales on race day.  Feelin’ generous? You can grab extras for your cheer squad, friends, or taco-loving family, too.

Because let’s be honest—everyone wants tacos after a race.

*Register by September 1st to ensure you receive your preferred shirt size.  Registrations after September 1st will still include a shirt, but size availability cannot be guaranteed.

 

Packet Pickup Details

Race week will kick off with two packet pickups! 

 

 Thursday, November 6th 3-6pm 

Join us @ Philadelphia Runner in Glen Mills, Pa for packet pickup and enjoy a 10% discount off of runner apparel, shoes & gear! 

Location: 505 Glen Eagle Square, Glen Mills Pa 19342

 

 Friday, November 7th  5-7PM

Join us in Kennett Square @ The Square for packet pickup, athletic vendors, and pre-race day entertainment. 

Location: The Square @ The Race Zone (The Borough Municipality Parking Lot) 600 South Broad Street, Kennett Square Pa 19348

 

* Saturday November 8th (pre-race) from 7:00-7:45am sharp

Race Day packet pickup is limited to out of town runners ONLY.  If you are a local runner and choose to pickup your packet on race morning between 7:00-7:45am, there will be a required $10 donation to one of our 2025 charity partners. 

 

Parking:

Friday Night, park within The Square or @ Kennett High School 

Saturday, refer to race day parking (see below)

Registration is available online until 7:45am on Saturday, November 8th.  Remember, all packets must be picked up in person before Packet Pickup closes at 7:45am on November 8th.

 

Race Pricing

Half Marathon 

  • $90    4/1
  • $110  4/2 through 11:59pm on 6/1
  • $125  6/2 through 11:59pm on 8/1

Running as a Team

Got a crew? Ready to rally your Shroomie Team? 

Training and racing are always more fun with your Shroomies by your side!  Form a team, and once you hit 15 runners your team will unlock discounts. Register 20 and receive exclusive perks like a private team porta-potty (yes, really!) and a designated team location to pop a tent and celebrate together at the after-party. Teams of 30+ qualify for a registration discount.  Email Sarah@runksqmushroom.com with all team questions. 

So, grab your friends, lace up, and let’s turn race day into the ultimate Shroomie celebration! 🍄✨

 

How Does it Work? 

When registering you will have the option to Join a Group/Team.  All Members of a TEAM are linked by their team name and password.  As your team grows, everyone benefits, even those who register first!  The system will automatically refund everyone on the team who has already registered and charge the new team members the new rate. Once you hit 15 shroomies, the first 14 to register will automatically receive a $10 refund to their card, and the 15th member (and anyone else who registers after that!) will get the discounted rate automatically.  Registrants that do not initially register with their group may not be eligible for refunds or discounts.

 

Race Parking

For race day, participants and spectators can park in the following lots: 

  • Kennett High School located off of South Street & Union Street (PA 82)
  • The YMCA Outdoor Swimming Pool Lot located on South Walnut Street
  • The Municipal Parking Lot located on East Linden & North Union Street
  • CARS ARE NOT PERMITTED TO PARK ON RACE ROADS AND WILL BE TICKED & TOWED AT THE OWNER'S EXPENSE 

Please note that Kennett High School and The YMCA Lots fill up quickly! The Municipal Lot is approximately 1/2 of a mile from the race start. 

 

Gear Check

Opens @ 7:00AM & Closes @ 12:00pm 

Before you line up to run, drop-off your pre-race/post-race clothing and belongings at the Gear Check. While you run, your gear will be held at Gear Check. Participants may pick up their Gear Check bag at Packet Pick Up when you pick up your packet or on race day at the Gear Check tent. The Gear Check tent will be located inside the Square within the post-race party area.  Attach your bib number tear-off on your bag before you leave it with the Gear Check crew. After the race, reclaim your checked bag at the designated Gear Check area. Please note: DO NOT leave valuables, cash or jewelry in your gear bag. The event is not responsible for any lost items. Gear bags must be claimed before 12:00 PM on race day. 
 

Course Rules

If you like to listen to music while you run, for your safety and others’, please be aware of your surroundings.

name: Coronado Rotary Low Tide Ride & Stride
description:
Celebrate the 28th Anniversary of the Low Tide Ride & Stride with a our 5K Course during the lowest tide of the month on the beach from North Beach down to the end of the Shores and back. Kick off summer with this fun, family-friendly, 5K chip-timed race. Run! Walk! Bike! Stroll! This Coronado signature event takes place along one of the top 10 beaches in the world and provides much needed funds with Local Military and First Responders being the primary beneficiaries. Drop your beach chair in Sunset Park along with your reusable water bottle. After the race, kick back and enjoy LIVE MUSIC, grab a snack, visit local vendors' booths, and more.                                                  

WHY THE 5K COURSE?

If you have participated in past Low Tide Ride & Stride events, you may have noticed military and civilian volunteers lining the beach along the State Park and Navy Base. They were protecting the Least Tern’s nesting grounds. You see, the Least Terns are an endangered species and their numbers continue to dwindle. Even the military must limit their training on the beach during nesting season March – September. According to the Audubon Society, since 1970 we have lost half of all bird populations globally. By keeping the course of the race off of the Amphibious Base, Rotary is protecting critical nesting grounds for the Least Tern and Snowy Plover. We are excited for race course -- less hassle, family friendly, and fun at Sunset Park!  We can’t think of a better way to bike, run, walk and celebrate the beginning of summer than the Low Tide Ride & Stride!. 

For any questions please contact the event organizer at info@lowtideride.com or call (734) 945-6443.

name: 13th Annual 'Due Run 4 Education
description:
Get inspired and join the Ladue Education Foundation & Alumni Association (LEF) at the 13th Annual 'Due Run 4 Education! The beloved tradition of the ’Due Run 4 Education continues this year with a twist: you can participate either in-person OR virtually! 

In-Person
Join us on September 27 starting at 7:00 am (shotgun start at 8:30) am in McKenna Plaza at the Ladue Horton Watkins Stadium. All ages are invited to participate in either a 5K or a 1-mile fun run that will start and finish on the stadium track. The event will include a live DJ, snacks & refreshments, vendor booths, awards and prizes with a chance to check yourself out on the stadium's Jumbotron.  The race is organized by Big River Running Company and will feature chip timing. 

Virtual
You can run or walk at any location you choose, at any time during the week, September 27 - October 4! Go to the park with the family or run on your treadmill, whatever you prefer. Keep your desired pace and time yourself so you can post the results. And if it turns out to be a lazy day, you can sleep in and still feel good about donating!

Either way, you receive a T-shirt, and, most importantly, you support the LEF and its amazing grants and programs that provide academic and enrichment opportunities for Ladue Schools students and staff.

If you’ve never done an in-person or virtual 5K or 1-mile run, it’s a great, low-stress alternative that encourages a fitness for the whole family!

description: L.A. Chinatown Firecracker Run Committee, Inc. name: Westport Road Runners Summer Series
description:
A series of ten progressively longer races, held at various locations throughout the Town of Westport.

We're happy to announce the 63rd annual Roadrunners Summer Series! In keeping with state COVID19 guidelines for road races, things will look a little different than they have in the past. To keep runners and volunteers safe, we will be instituting the follow protocols:

  1. There will be no in-person race day registration on paper forms. Online registration will remain open until the start time. Runners should register before arriving at the race site, or on their phones when they get there, then check in with other pre-registered runners.
  2. Once again, we will utilize ChronoTrack chip timing technology for all races. This will give all runners a net or "chip" time based on when they cross the start in the first five races, and will have the added benefit of almost instant results. If you sign up for text alerts, your finish time and place will be waiting for you on your phone when you get back to your car. You will also receive an email later on race morning with your individual result, with a video clip of your finish. Thanks to Pequot Runners for providing timing bibs and chips!
  3. To facilitate this, all runners must check in before the race and be assigned a race bib, which must be worn on the front of your shirt or shorts during the race. If you have a bib from a previous Series race you should re-use that, but you still need to check in and tell the volunteer your number.
Note that these protocols may change if state guidelines for road races are modified.

 

ONCE AGAIN - PHOTOS! RunSignUp has added the ability for runners to upload photos to this site. So, after you complete your race, post a photo or two of your run - at the start, finish or in between. The more we get, the better! Just click on the Photo tab on the left side of the screen and post away!

Due to the pricing structure for online registration, which includes a $2.61 processing fee for each transaction, it will be MUCH cheaper to register for the full 10-race Series if you are doing more than six races. We strongly recommend you take advantage of the Series discount. It will also eliminate the need to register for each race separately online. AND IF YOU REGISTER BY JULY 2, YOU'LL GET A SHORT SLEEVE TECH SHIRT!

name: Care4 Breast Cancer Hybrid 5K
description:
Family Health Partnership Clinic is proud to present the 25th Annual Care4 Breast Cancer 5K Run/Walk on Sunday, October 19th at Woodstock North High School!

The Care4 Breast Cancer 5K celebrates survivors, supports our breast cancer warriors and honors the loved ones we have lost too early.  It is an inspiring and moving event that makes a huge impact in our community.  The Care4 5K raises critical funds to support Family Health Partnership Clinic in it's mission to provide health care services to the uninsured adults of McHenry County.  Specifically, the funds raised are pledged to breast cancer education, early diagnosis & detection, annual screenings and other women's health programs.  We know that early detection is key to survival and, with your help, we can give everyone the hope and support they need.

The Care4 will again have a VIRTUAL option!  Our Care4 Family extends to all four corners of the country and we want to ensure that everyone is included so we are thrilled to be able to offer a VIRTUAL CARE4 Experience.  As a VIRTUAL participant, you can choose the time and place to walk, run or be active from October 12th thru October 19th.   Upload your results along with pictures of you and your Care4 Crew wearing your swag.  Those signed up for the Virtual Care4 can opt in for shipping and your shirt and bib will be shipped by October 9th. 

So together, let’s spread the Care4 message far and wide- making sure that EVERYONE has access to breast cancer screenings and early detection, preventative care and education!  Early diagnosis is key to survival and without health insurance, early detection may not happen.  Uninsured women were nearly 2.6 times more likely to be diagnosed with a later stage of the disease.  With your support, FHPC can change that because, we believe, everyone deserves healthcare!

The Clinic has been providing quality health care to the uninsured men and women of McHenry County since 1996!  For more info about FHPC, visit hpclinic.org.

Registration includes Care4 T-shirt (guaranteed size if registered by 10/10, so don't miss out- register today!)

name: MISSION INN RUN
description:
The 48th Annual Mission Inn Run returns to downtown Riverside on October 19, 2025! 

The Mission Inn Run, a signature Riverside event and key fundraiser for the Mission Inn Foundation, has been a Southern California Tradition for nearly 50 years. This historic race has traditionally launched in downtown Riverside, winding through the parks, landmarks and historic neighborhoods of our town. Proceeds support the nonprofit Mission Inn Foundation and Museum.

Races include the 5K, 10K and ½ Marathon with dedicated 5K Walk (perfect for the kids and pups!) Everyone from competitors to casual strollers are invited to join us!

The Mission Inn Run is the trademarked intellectual property of the Mission Inn Foundation.  There is no affiliation with the Historic Mission Inn Corporation, nor does the Historic Mission Inn Corporation benefit from or support this event.  All funds raised go to the Mission Inn Foundation, a 501c3 non-profit organization.  For more information about the Mission Inn Foundation, please visit www.missioninnmuseum.org

name: Families Run for Ovarian Cancer ROC Star 5k & 1-Mile Run/Walk
description:
Are you ready to ROC? Join us for the 19th annual Families Run for Ovarian Cancer ROC Star Run/ Walk - at our NEW LOCATION in TOWER GROVE PARK! The ROC Star event was started in 2006 by the Jorgensen family as their wife, mother and Nana, Brenda, fought her own battle with ovarian cancer. Sadly, she lost that battle in 2011 but the event continues to honor her spirit and to raise funds for ovarian cancer research and ongoing awareness programs through St. Louis Ovarian Cancer Awareness. 

 

Participants can register for a timed 5k run/ walk or a 1-mile fun run/ walk - or if you can't join us in person you can ROC from Home! All event registration includes a limited edition shirt for all participants while supplies last. Please note ROC from Home participants' event shirts will be mailed AFTER the in-person event and a shipping charge of $5 will be added to each registration.

 

The event is family and dog-friendly and will include a Survivor Ceremony, as well as the Honor and Memory Wall, Flu shots from our friends at Walgreens (ages 7+), music by TKO DJs, roaming selfie stations, visits from Fredbird and Louie, and of course the beloved Bubble Bus. 

 

Food and treats will include Krispy Kreme donuts and bananas in the morning. Coffee and specialty drinks will be available for purchase from Travelin' Tom's Coffee Truck. After race start, Kona Ice will be providing complimentary sweet treats to participants, as well as complimentary hot dogs and chips from K's Unique Dogs while supplies last. Fallon's Bar & Grill will be providing beer for our 21+ ROC Stars. 

 

Survivor Ceremony 
To recognize and honor our ovarian cancer survivors in attendance during our ceremony we will call each survivor by name and as they come forward we will share a flower and applaud them. All registered survivors in attendance should make their way to the stage for the ceremony and remain afterwards for a group photo.

 

Honor & Memory Wall
The event will host an "In Honor and Memory" wall where participants can attach a photo, write a message, or share an inspiring quote and more. SLOCA will provide the materials but feel free to bring photos. Please note, materials affixed to the memory wall cannot be returned.

name: Dove Dash & Dog Dash: 1K/5K Walk/Run & Pancake Breakfast
description:
Over the past twenty-five years, the Dove Dash has become one of the most anticipated fundraising events in Rancho Santa Margarita, drawing families, businesses, and community members year after year. This beloved community event is not only a day of fun but also an opportunity to make a meaningful impact.

We are thrilled to announce the 2025 Dove Dash & Dog Dash, featuring both an in-person 5K and Walk-A-Thon, along with a virtual option, all in support of the High Hopes Head Injury Program. High Hopes (www.HighHopes.ws) is a 501(c)(3) charitable non-profit organization dedicated to raising funds for individuals suffering from Traumatic Brain Injury (TBI), Stroke, and Multiple Sclerosis (MS).

100% of the proceeds from this event will go directly toward providing scholarships for economically disadvantaged individuals to receive essential rehabilitation services at High Hopes. This support is critical in helping individuals regain their independence and quality of life. High Hopes is nationally recognized for its transformative rehabilitation programs, focused on assisting those affected by traumatic head injuries, strokes, and MS.

New for 2025: This year, we are excited to introduce a new event for your dogs to participate in! The addition of the Family 1K course opens up new opportunities for individuals of all abilities to join in the fun. We welcome walkers, runners, and families—whether using strollers, walkers, wheelchairs, or receiving assistance from caregivers. This inclusive event ensures everyone can be a part of the Dove Dash experience.

New Courses:
The 5K course has been revamped to take participants through the stunning streets of Dove Canyon, offering panoramic views of the surrounding hills, the Jack Nicklaus Signature Golf Course, and the beautiful local neighborhoods. The updated route is designed to be more scenic and enjoyable, providing a memorable experience for all participants.

We are also excited to announce that dogs are welcome this year, allowing our four-legged friends to join in the fun! It’s a fantastic opportunity for families to come together, enjoy a day of exercise, and support an important cause.

We invite you to join us for the 2025 Dove Dash & Dog Dash—whether by running, walking, or supporting from the sidelines. Your participation will directly benefit those in need of life-changing rehabilitation, making a meaningful difference in the lives of individuals affected by TBI, Stroke, and MS.

 

To view the 5K race map click here.  The 5K starts at 8 AM.

To view the 1K and the Dog dash race map click here.  The 1K starts at 8:45 AM.

name: Shore 2 The Pour Beach Run 2025
description:
Will Run for Beer! 

Two Roads Brewing Company is hosting its Annual Shore to The Pour 3-mile (approximate) Beach race. Join us Saturday, August 23rd; race kicks off at 9:30am! $45.00 entry fee will include a 2025 Two Roads Race T-shirt, Medal & (2) beers at the end of the race. A portion of the proceeds will be donated to Audubon Connecticut at Stratford Point. Limited spots available! 

REGISTRATION DETAILS
Spots are limited, don’t wait to sign up! There will NOT be day of registration for this race. 
You must register by Friday August 1st to guarantee their shirt size for the 2025 Shore 2 the Pour Race T! After this date, shirts may be available for participants, but we cannot guarantee your size will be available. 

DAY BEFORE CHECK-IN
Save yourself time and check-in for the race the night before! Come on down to Two Roads on Friday August 22nd and check-in to receive your bib (with chip), race t and most importantly, beer tickets to redeem after the run! Check-in will be located in the Beer Garden (weather permitted) @ 1700 Stratford Ave from 4-6:30pm. 

Participants are welcome to check-in their friends and family members who are also participating, in fact we encourage it! 

DAY OF CHECK-IN
Can’t check-in the night before, not a problem! Day of race check-in will be at Short Beach (pavilion 1) from 7:30-9:15am.
Look for the signs!

COURSE DESCRIPTION
Your journey runs on the park driveway and town roads the first mile. Entering the Audubon Center, you will run 7/10 mi on a hard packed grass path around the perimeter of the property. Be prepared to enjoy a beautiful view of Long Island Sound, Stratford Harbor, butterflies, birds, and more! After a short run back on the driveway you’ll run onto the “Two Roads Trail” which is again, hard packed grass and some gravel.

The fun begins just after mile two! The course drops down to beach level and from there you’ll run completely on the sand along the water back to the finish. 

The finish will be on the sand/hard packed grass area near the pavilion. 
Each participant's finish time will be “Chip” recorded as they cross the finish line. 
As participants finish, they will receive their Two Roads medal and a text message and/or email with their finishing time!

COURSE MAP

A list of overall finishing times for all competitors will be continually updated and sent to your email on file while the race is in progress.
The final race results should be posted by 10am


Water Stop: There will be a water stop a little after the halfway point inside the Audubon grounds. We also encourage everyone to run with a water bottle as temps can be very hot during the summer. Please be respectful and use the trash cans located at this water stop! 

NEW THIS YEAR
New this year: we're excited to introduce our first-ever Kid Fun Run! This free beachside dash kicks off at 11:30AM—just after the main race—so parents can cheer on their little runners while enjoying a pint. All kids will receive a participation medal, and please note: children must be supervised by an adult at all times and cannot be left unattended during the main event.

TIPS AND NOTES  
- For your safety, participants should always remain to the LEFT side of the road indicated by cones, signs, or volunteers. 
- Please follow all instructions of the course marshals and only cross a street when instructed to do so by the course volunteers.
 Once crossing the finish line, please keep moving towards the pavilion to allow room for other runners. Remember, standing too close to the finish line can easily trigger your chip and your time may be changed which will alter your results. 
-Participants are welcome to run with strollers but, please make note that the last leg of the race is on the sand. There are “steps” (mainly rocks) to get from the Audubon Center to the beach. 

 POST RACE CELEBRATION
Let’s not forget the best part of the race, the post-race celebration! Once you cross the finish line join us back at the pavilion for a post-race celebration! There will be music, health related vendors and of course, delicious beer! Stay tuned for more information on vendors, food truck and musical performances! 

Awards!
During our post-race celebration, we will have an award ceremony for the following categories
1st Place Man by Age Groups 
 Age Groups: Under 21, 21-35, 36-50, 51+
1st Place Woman by Age Groups 
 Age Groups: Under 21, 21-35, 36-50, 51+
Shore Like Your Style Award- Have fun and get dressed up for the big race!
The Road Less Traveled Award- The person who traveled the farthest to attend the race 

What is Audubon Connecticut? 
Audubon Connecticut supports programs that connect people to nature across the state. Through land stewardship, science, education and advocacy, Audubon Connecticut preserves habitat and protects bird species and other wildlife that are of state, national and global concern.  Stratford Point, which is managed by Audubon Connecticut, is one of the best birding destinations in the state and provides 40 acres of habitat that is enjoyed by people, and wildlife. Visit their website here.

"With past support from Two Roads, Audubon Connecticut has planted hundreds of trees, shrubs, and perennials that benefit wildlife and worked to control invasive plant species at Stratford Point. More recently, Audubon and partners have led the restoration efforts at the Great Meadows Marsh, a unit of the Stewart B. McKinney National Wildlife Refuge. As part of the project, we worked with the Town of Stratford to employ 12 local high school students as Salt Marsh Stewards.  The stewards, many volunteers, and partners planted over 150,000 native plants in the restored marsh. Funding from the 2025 Shore 2 Pour will go towards implementing the Salt Marsh Stewards program again in 2026, giving additional students an opportunity to explore careers in conservation and make a difference in their own community.” (Corrie Folsom-O'Keefe, Stratford Point Audubon Representative)

About Leah...

On October 8, 2013, just a month after starting kindergarten at Matthew Patterson Elementary School in Putnam County, Leah was diagnosed with Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia (ALL). Suddenly her world changed to countless trips to Maria Fareri Children’s Hospital; numerous blood transfusions; and a life of seclusion, away from germs and any viruses that could be very harmful. Leah couldn’t return to school and wasn’t able to see her friends for most of the year.

Because of the funds raised by LLS and because of people like you who support events like this Leah and others have benefited from the services LLS offers. With the support of the Leukemia and Lymphoma Society Leah has gotten through treatments and realized a life after her fight with blood cancer. Her family also got the support they needed throughout, that is why we continue to raise money, to help future families like Leah's. Having cancer certainly isn't fair especially for a child and as a parent I can't imagine what it would be like to tell your child that they have cancer. This is why I honor Leah and help work towards finding the cures.

The Leukemia and Lymphoma Society has a commitment to people like Leah struggling and fighting to beat cancer. Blood cancer does not discriminate by age, as you can see. It affects the lives of many people and families and the Leukemia and Lymphoma Society exists to not only help those diagnosed with blood cancer through experimental treatments, they provide support to the families as well. This 5k run is in honor of Leah and all its proceeds will go directly to LLS to provide services to make the fight easier for survivors like Leah.

name: 2025 MHRRC Dutchess County Classic
description:
Join us for the 47th Annual Mid-Hudson Road Runners Club Dutchess County Classic!

Similar to the last few years, this years event will be split over two days with the 1k Kids Fun Run and 5k on Saturday, September 27th on Robinson Lane in Wappingers Falls, NY and the 10k and Half-Marathon on Sunday, September 28th on the William R. Steinhaus Dutchess Rail Trail / Walkway Over the Hudson in Poughkeepsie, NY.

All courses are flat and scenic, great for seasoned runners and first timers alike.  The races will showcase the beauty of the Hudson Valley, including beautiful farm land and views of the Hudson River.  Each race is professionally timed and takes place on a USATF certified course, making the Dutchess County Classic a "must-race" for anyone looking to set their next PR. There are t-shirts for pre-registered (on or before August 31st) runners and finisher medals for the 5k, 10k, half marathon and a special finisher medal for anyone who finishes a race on both days.  In order to receive the special finisher medal for competing on both days you must register for a "COMBO" event.  COMBO prices reflect a $5 discount.

There will be price increases for all races after the first 444 registrants then on July 1 and September 22, so register early to save!

Start Location & Times

Saturday, September 27th

The kids 1k race will be held on Saturday, September 27th, starting at 8:30 am from Robinson Lane Park (95 Robinson Lane, Wappingers Falls, NY 12590). Kids who are pre-registered always run for free. This event is for kids ages 12 and under.

The 5k race will be held on Saturday, September 27th, starting at 9:00 am from Robinson Lane Park (95 Robinson Lane, Wappingers Falls, NY 12590).  We have adjusted the course to start/finish at the pavilion to reduce traffic congestion at the gate.  This is a flat, out and back "T - Shape" course and is USATF certified.  For those who raced last year, it is a very similar course.  An updated certified map has been posted.

Sunday, September 28th

The half marathon and 10k will both start and end at Dutchess Community College (53 Pendell Road, Poughkeepsie, NY 12601).  Both races will start at 7:30 am. There is a wheel chair option for the half marathon only.

Due to the large volume of runners expected, area road closures and the likelihood for congestion during parking, it is recommended that you arrive at the race at least an hour and a half before race start time even if you already have your bib.

Both the half & 10k will enter the Hudson Valley Rail Trail via the Morgan Lake Trailhead and will include an out & back over the Walkway Over the Hudson.  The 10k runners will head to the finish when they get back near the Morgan Lake Trailhead while the half marathon will continue straight at Morgan Lake and do an out and back from there to the end of the overpass on Manchester Rd and then finish along Creek Road to DCC.  Both courses are USATF certified.

Giveaways & Prizes

There will be giveaway shirts (image to be released once available) for all kids, 5K, 10k and half marathon participants who register before Sunday, August 18th, 11:59 pm. There is no guarantee that you will receive a shirt if you register after August 31st.

Prizes will be given for the top 3 overall finishers in each race as well as awards for the top 3 in each age group (10 year age groups).

We will have CASH prizes for our top 3 overall male and female and 1st place masters (50+) male and female athletes in the 5k & HALF-MARATHON ONLY.

Half-Marathon Overall: $300 - 1st, $200 - 2nd, $100 - 3rd, Half-Marathon Masters (50+): $200 - 1st

5k Overall: $100 - 1st, $50 - 2nd, $25 - 3rd, 5k Masters (50+): $75 - 1st

Bib Pickup & Registration Details 

Bib pickup information will be released as we get closer to the event and details are finalized.  There will be an option for bib pickup prior to race day and race morning.  Please plan to register ahead of time as there may or may not be limited race day registration depending on if an event sells out.

Unfortunately, there are no refunds.

Restrictions & Special Circumstances

Runners may register for only one race per day.  Runners must maintain a pace of at least 15 minutes or better in all events with the exception of the kids 1k fun run.  All participants under 18 years of age must have parent/guardian approval to run a race.

There are NO STROLLERS allowed in the 5k, 10k or Half-Marathon.  Strollers are permitted in the Kids 1k Fun Run.

If you have special circumstances which require direct attention, please let us know -- we will do our best to accommodate you.

Please direct all inquiries and requests to mhrrc.info@gmail.com

**Please visit www.dutchesscountyclassic.org and follow our Facebook page MHRRC / Dutchess County Classic for up to date news and information!**

About Bimbo Global Race 

This is our 10th edition to host our Global race which was created to unite participants across the World to compete together. Our Global race is for everyone: competitive runners, casual walkers, families, friends and everyday joggers looking to come out and participate in Bimbo's healthy, active lifestyle initiative. It is truly a global event; in 2016, Bimbo Global Race (formally known as Global Energy Race) broke the Guinness Book of World Records for the most 10K races held simultaneously worldwide on the same day!

 

In addition to this Global happening, Bimbo Bakeries USA is proud to partner with Feeding America and their local area food banks during the month of September (Hunger Action Month) to give back during these times of need and support the local community. For every individual who participates in this year's race, Bimbo Bakeries will donate bread to the Los Angeles Regional Food Bank. Every step helps feed someone in need to nourish a better World.

name: 2025 Duo Dash
description:
Get Ready for the 4th Annual Duo Dash 5K & 1-Mile Dog Walk!

Mark your calendars — the Duo Dash is back! Lace up your shoes, leash up your pups, and join us for a day of fun, fitness, and fundraising, all to benefit Duo Dogs.

name: Cobb County 5K benefitting Make a Wish Georgia
description:
Every year, Cobb County hosts the Make-A-Wish 5K, a 5-kilometer run the benefits of which are donated to Make-A-Wish® Georgia to grant wishes for Cobb County children with critical illnesses. This year, there are 47 children in Cobb County waiting to have his or her wish granted. It is our hope to grant more wishes and we know that it takes a community to make this happen. Help us put a smile on a child's face by making their wish come true.

The Make-A-Wish 5K is a Peachtree Road Race qualifying event.

Participants assemble on the Marietta Square, pre-race festivities begins at 7:20 a.m., the race begins at 8:00 a.m. Walk-up registration begins at 6:30 a.m. Join us for the fun and let's run for a great cause!

name: The Hoag OC Marathon Running Festival
description: The Hoag OC Marathon Running Festival includes four different runs during the first weekend in May annually. The weekend of running begins at the OC Fair and Event Center on Saturday morning with the award winning Hoag Kids Run the OC when nearly 9,000 kids from over 150 Orange County schools participate. The afternoon kicks off with the CELEBRATE OC Festival with local sports teams, craft brews and some of Orange County's iconic brands and live music all day. Later in the day on Saturday, the OC 5K takes place with a fun, flat tour of the OC Fairgrounds and nearby Orange Coast College followed by the Celebrate OC Finish Festival. Sunday morning begins early in Newport Beach. The exceptional OC Marathon & Half Marathon course is a blend of chic coastal scenery, tranquil nature and sophisticated arts and shopping which equal the best of OC. Enjoy breathtaking views of the Pacific Ocean and cruise down historic PCH through the seaside village of Corona del Mar. Run above pristine wetlands of Upper Newport, the Arts District and shopping mecca of South Coast Plaza in the "Heart of the OC" to the supportive cheers of residents in the many diverse neighborhoods and finish with a huge party at the Sunday Celebrate Finish Festival at the OC Fair and Event Center.

description:

name: Jackson-Banks Area FCA 5K
description:
Come out and support Jackson-Banks Area Fellowship of Christian Athletes as we seek to see every coach and every athlete enter into a growing relationship with Jesus Christ and His Church! Every dollar raised from this event will go towards sending Jackson and Banks Area coaches and athletes to camp. 

Fellowship of Christian Athletes is a Non-profit 501c. All funding for our ministry is provided through our amazing donors. Without YOU, we cannot do what we do. THANK YOU for your faithful support!!!

Visit our website to learn more about our ministry and how you can be involved as we strive to share the Gospel with EVERY coach and EVERY athlete in our community. www.jbafca.org

name: Gobble on the Green 5K
description:
Turkey, cornbread dressing, pumpkin pie, football, and family time … there are so many reasons to love Thanksgiving! Did we mention pie? Each family has its own activities and traditions to look forward to. The Village Green offers a 5K Run/Walk turkey-trot, Gobble On the Green!

 

T-Shirts: The final t-shirt order was placed at 2:30pm on Nov. 12th. Additional t-shirts will not be available on race day this year. T-Shirts are only available to those registered by November 12th.

While extra t-shirts will not be available on race day this year, we still invite you to sign up and be part of the Thanksgiving Day fun! Don't miss out on this exciting event—register today and join us for a memorable race experience!

 

Pre-Race Check In: Early check in will be available on Wednesday, November 27th from 3-6pm at The Village Green Lewis Hall (Address: 160 Frank Allen Road in Cashiers). Here, participants will receive their bibs and t-shirts. Participants are strongly encouraged to check in early on November 27th to ensure an on-time race start on Thanksgiving morning.

 

Race day check-in will be available inside Lewis Hall from 7:30am-8:45am!

 

Event and Course Details: The race course map and written directions are attached included on this race website. There will be signage and volunteers posted along the racecourse to assist with directions.

 

If you are a parent with a stroller, please start the race at the back of the group. Please keep in mind that some area of the race are gravel, grass, dirt, and paved. Also, while we are a dog friendly park, due to the number of participants, there is no dog participation in this event. If spectators must bring their dog, they must be leashed and under control of their owner at all times. 

 

Awards: The top two overall winners (male and female) will receive pies in addition to race medals. Age level awards will be given to the top two finishers (male and female) in 7 age groups.

 

Four door prizes from local businesses will be given based on random bib number drawings.

 

**PARTICIPANTS MUST BE PRESENT TO WIN DOOR PRIZES AND AWARDS**

 

All participants' race times will be posted to the Gobble on The Green Run Sign Up website post race. Thank you for participating in the 2024 Gobble on The Green!

 

Most of all, thank you for your support of The Village Green, a 501c3 non-profit park system. Your registration in Gobble allows The Village Green to operate and maintain a 13+ acre nonprofit park that is open 365 days a year for free, where over 270 days of free community events occur! We look forward to seeing you bright and early on Thanksgiving to Gobble on The Green! This event is held rain or shine!

name: Big River Unpaved
description:
Have you considered getting into trail running or hiking, but didn’t know where to start, or were apprehensive about venturing out onto the trails alone? Big River Unpaved is a FREE, fun, friendly, and first-class training program for runners and walkers of all abilities. This program is geared for people new to hiking or trail running, looking for a fun, social, and supportive atmosphere in which to venture out into the outdoors. Our trail excursions will be supported by guides who will help you “stay found” and share knowledge about trail etiquette and technique. Our trail excursions will help make hitting the trails more comfortable and accessible by providing comradery and education in a fun, social, and supportive atmosphere. 

This program is FREE! So get ready to lace up your trail shoes and get outside!

Details:

  • Weekly trail excursions on Sunday mornings at various locations throughout the St. Louis metro area. (Some of these trails will be a 30+ minute drive from the city and mid-county. The location schedule will be shared with registered participants.) The spring season also includes Thursday evening trail outings.
  • Weekly email newsletter to keep you informed
  • Beginner-friendly
  • Experienced Trail Guides to share motivation and advice (and help you “stay found”)
  • Age requirements - For safety reasons we can't accommodate unaccompanied minors. Those under 18 must be accompanied by (running/hiking with) their guardian for the duration of any trail excursion
  • Hiking Pace - Our Hike Guides will generally maintain a pace faster than 2.5mph or 24:00/mile

For more information, visit https://www.bigriverrunning.com/run/unpaved/

description: Join us Saturday, November 8, 2025 for a fun-fulled Veteran's Day themed celebration! name: Honor Our Veterans 5k
description:
Run or Walk to Support Our Veterans at the 4th Annual Homes for the Brave 5K!

 

Join us on Veterans Day, November 11, 2025 at Sherwood Island State Park in Westport for a meaningful event that brings together runners and walkers of all abilities. Set against the stunning backdrop of Long Island Sound, this race isn’t just about the views—it’s about making a real difference for those who have served our country.

 

Every step you take helps U.S. Veterans experiencing homelessness. All proceeds and donations from the event directly benefit Homes for the Brave, a nonprofit in Bridgeport dedicated to providing housing, programs, and services to Veterans in need.

 

Whether running, walking, or cheering from the sidelines, your participation shows your support for the brave Men and Women who have sacrificed so much. We invite you to be part of this impactful day and honor our Veterans in any way you can.

 

What is Homes for the Brave?

 

Homes for the Brave (HFTB), is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit headquartered in Bridgeport, CT. The mission of Homes for the Brave is, with an emphasis on Veterans, to provide the housing and services necessary for individuals experiencing homelessness to return to productive and meaningful lives. HFTB staff works with Veterans to create personalized goals to help them achieve stable income and housing and increase their self-determination. Since its creation in 1998, HFTB has served over 1,700 individuals, while engaging with hundreds of volunteers and local organizations to craft an ever-expanding network of support. They strive to be a beacon of hope and inspiration for the community by providing innovative, comprehensive, and compassionate programs that demonstrate their dedication to our Veterans. For more information visit   www.homesforthebrave.org 

 

History of the event

 

Priscilla Sanchez Garcia created this annual event to honor the memory of her father, Samuel Sanchez, and his altruistic nature. As a celebration of his life and in efforts to continue his mission of supporting Veterans, we continue to run and walk for a cause. Samuel Sanchez, a Marine Corp Veteran and Purple Heart Recipient, passed away on Father’s Day 2022. 

 

The story of Priscilla’s father has not only inspired her but also touched the hearts of many. Her dedication to memorializing her father’s legacy and commitment to charity lives on. This year, she decided to pass the torch and entrust this event to Homes for the Brave, an organization that has supported the 5k since its beginning and is instilled with the same values as her father. Join us in honoring his memory and supporting Veterans by participating in the Annual Honor Our Veterans 5k.

name: Thrive San Diego Half Marathon & 5K
description:
The Kaiser Permanente Thrive Half Marathon & 5K returns for its 9th year!

We’re excited to THRIVE with you on Saturday, November 1, 2025! More than just a race, it’s an invitation for the entire San Diego community to “Thrive” together—staying active, eating healthy, living well, and giving back. All courses start and finish at Ski Beach in Mission Bay, offering fast, flat stretches with beautiful Mission Bay views and refreshing ocean breezes.

Each runner will cover approximately 6.5 miles before handing off the "baton" to your teammate at Telecote Shores. This scenic route along Crown Point starts on Ingraham St and finishes at Ski Beach in Mission Bay, featuring fast, flat stretches, breathtaking bay views, and refreshing ocean breezes.

5K:

Charity:

For more information on Make-A-Wish San Diego, visit thrivehalfmarathon.com/charity/.

name: Classic 107.3 Beat Beethoven 5K
description:
Join us Sunday, April 19, 2026 at Creve Coeur Lake Park for our 5th Annual run/walk event for Classic 107.3 - Radio Arts Foundation, the only community-supported arts and classical radio station in St. Louis! For those interested in a more relaxed experience, try the Missy Mazzoli Mile, named in honor of the Grammy-nominated contemporary classical composer recently described as “Brooklyn’s post-millennial Mozart”. Ready, set, Beethoven!

name: 2025 Bottleneck Bridge Ride presented by Festus Tourism Commission
description:
Get ready for a special year—2025 marks the 10th anniversary of the Bottleneck Bridge Ride! This beloved ride has been bringing cyclists together for a decade, and we’re making this milestone one to remember. With scenic routes, great company, and an unforgettable post-ride celebration, there’s never been a better time to join the fun. Don’t miss out on this exciting anniversary edition of the ride!
 
The Bottleneck Bridge Ride is presented by the Festus Tourism Commission and co-hosted in partnership with Trailnet and the Jefferson County Growth Association. Affectionately known as "One Hill of a Ride," this event offers routes for every skill level, taking cyclists on a scenic journey through Jefferson County with rest stops at wineries, restaurants, and historic sites like Sandy Creek Covered Bridge.
 
For our younger riders, we are excited to announce the return of the kids' races, thanks to Living Life on 2 Wheels. This event is always a hit and adds extra fun to the day. Registration is free, and every child who participates will receive a prize.

  • Coffee and pre-ride energy bars for morning fuel
  • SAG support and HAM radio communications
  • Post-ride street party with live music and vendor expo

 

Training Rides! 

Join some of your fellow Bottleneck Bridge Brigaders on an official training ride! Stay tuned for dates and locations. Follow us on Facebook for updates.

name: HERoes in Deed HERo Run 2025
description:
Join "Jaimie's Crew" on Saturday, June 7, 2025, in beautiful Warwick, NY for our annual HERo 5K/10K run/walk. Help us celebrate the life and memory of our HERo and Warwick native, US Army LTC Jaimie Leonard, who was killed in Afghanistan on June 8, 2013. 

Bring your friends and family and "Embrace the Suck"! Participants may run or walk Warwick's scenic backroads on our USATF-certified 5K or 10K courses. This annual fundraiser event enables HERoes in Deed to continue supporting military and Veteran programs, to provide scholarships to Warwick High School students, and to honor local HERoes "in Deed" throughout the year.

Participants receive a commemorative race t-shirt; the first 200 to register also receive a commemorative challenge coin. *Register by May 1st to guarantee a shirt in your size on race day.*

name: 15th Annual Faithful Friends 5K & Mutt Mile
description:
You're invited to Faithful Friends Animal Society's 15TH ANNUAL 5K & Mutt Mile on Sunday, September 28th at Bellevue State Park. Not only is this our biggest fundraising event of the year, it's also the LARGEST dog-friendly race in Delaware!

name: Crown City Classic 12K & 5K
description:
The Most Patriotic Race on The West Coast!

 

We’re thrilled to celebrate the 52nd year of the Crown City Classic 12K & 5K Run along the stunning Coronado Bay! name: Avery Brewing Co. 4K on the 4th
description:
Join us at the new time of 8:00AM, for the 16th edition of the Avery Brewing Company 4K on the 4th, which is one of Boulder’s best running traditions to do on the 4th of July!

July 4th is celebrated in a number of different ways, with parades, barbecues, sparklers and fireworks, BUT there has been no better way since 2008 to get your July 4th morning off to a great start, than doing Boulder’s traditional Avery Brewing Company 4K on the 4th.

It is run on a flat and fast course, then followed by the best post-race party with Avery Brewing Company beer, Savory Cuisines Catering breakfast burritos and live music!

The NEW 8:00AM start time comes from participant feedback we have received over the last 2 years.

  • HEAT - It can be surprisingly warm at 9:00AM, and starting the race 1 hour earlier would allow participants to run/ walk in slightly cooler conditions.
  • PARTY - Starting the race 1 hour earlier, means participants can now party post-race for longer! Post race celebrations will still end at 11:00AM.

July 4th, also known as “Independence Day”, is a National holiday to mark the historic date in 1776, when the Declaration of Independence was approved by the Continental Congress. So wear your red, white and blue on Friday July 4th, and come and celebrate Independence Day with us!

To get your FREE T-Shirt, your must register BEFORE 11:59PM - SUNDAY JUNE 15.

  • Baby strollers ARE allowed.
  • NO Dogs are permitted in the race.
  • There are NO race refunds.
